meanings.definition: Having a rugged or uneven surface
meanings.sent1: The cragged mountain path was difficult to walk on.
meanings.sent2: The hiker admired the cragged rocks along the trail.
meanings.sent3: The cragged terrain made it challenging for the explorers to navigate.
meanings.sent4: Her cragged voice echoed through the empty canyon.
meanings.sent5: The cragged landscape looked like a giant's rough playground.

meanings.definition: A steep or rugged cliff or rock
meanings.sent1: The climbers scaled the cragged cliff with skill.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a beautiful scene of the cragged coastline.
meanings.sent3: The cragged in the distance seemed to call out to the adventurous souls.
meanings.sent4: The shipwreck lay at the base of the cragged, unforgiving rock.
meanings.sent5: The eagle soared high above the cragged peak, searching for prey.

meanings.definition: To form or make something jagged or rough
meanings.sent1: He cragged the edges of the paper to give it a unique look.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor cragged the clay to create a textured surface.
meanings.sent3: She cragged the wood to make it resemble ancient ruins.
meanings.sent4: The storm cragged the once smooth shoreline into a jagged coast.
meanings.sent5: The artist cragged the painting to add depth and character.
